DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicates whether lymphatic duct or blood vessel invasion (LVI) is identified in the pathology report

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredName: Pathology Tumor Vascular Invasion Lymphatic Invasion
Property.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural functional changes that result from disease processes.  Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.:A term referring to the presence of tumor emboli or tumor masses within any circulatory vessel.:A term referring to the presence of tumor emboli or tumor masses within lymphatic vessels.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
A term referring to the presence of tumor emboli or tumor masses within any circulatory vessel.
A term referring to the presence of tumor emboli or tumor masses within lymphatic vessels.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Tumor Vascular Invasion Lymphatic Invasion Pathology Report Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A code indicatiing whether there is a tumor emboli or tumor masses within any circulatory or lymphatic vessels identified in a pathology report.
